hackathon-description-text: Lots of people curate our news for us (Facebook, CNN, etc) so that we get only the news that we want. What if your job was to curate the top stories to different national security decision-makers that each had their own interests? Due to their incredibly demanding schedules, our nation's leaders receive only a quick briefing with a printed book containing the news and information they need to know. How would you curate a more relevant briefing book for these decision makers?

hackathon-judges.judge-role: CO-FOUNDER, PRODUCT & ENGINEERING LEAD AT SHE’S CODING
EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AT ADA DEVELOPER ACADEMY
DATA SCIENTIST AND TECH COMMUNITY ORGANIZER

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=220 2nd Ave S, Seattle, WA 98168, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: How impactful will this solution be for it’s target audience? Is it scalable?
How well designed is this solution, from front end through to UI/UX?
How well executed is this solution from start to finish?
